jurisdiction.title: School Curriculum and Standards Authority (Western Australia)

31FA7C2F37D04805899E9E473E3890FC.description: Develop texts (e.g. retell, describe personal stories)

6D5BD5A9FE254890B06B84DA578EFCB5.description: Share observations and ideas, using everyday language (e.g. oral retell, drawing, role-play)

49CC3EAC75C44A9A92E799372A43A2C0.description: Participate in decision-making processes (e.g. engage in group discussions, make shared decisions)

7E1AA1DCAFD646DBB2F02057739B0E30.description: Draw conclusions based on discussions of observations (e.g. answer questions, contribute to guided discussions)

649D83CB61C7404DBA09031F1756855C.description: Represent information gathered in different formats (e.g. drawings, diagrams, story maps, role-plays)

18296CC534B745A6BB473AB590F684FE.description: Explore points of view (e.g. understand that their point of view may differ from others)

D0104B9E57C548A6B0A89649F4F9FD35.description: Process information and/or data collected (e.g. sequence familiar events, answer questions, discuss observations)

677ADC94D6D441FCBEABB05D9A0FEF19.description: Sort and record information and/or data into simple categories (e.g. use graphic organisers, drawings)

7B0445180195477A87B1AE47CCE96EF4.description: Explore a range of sources (e.g. observations, interviews, photographs, print texts, digital sources)

19A4800859964679A3D5376176387E7A.description: Pose and respond to questions about the familiar

96E91ED432824238A43D0F94A2BDAA98.description: Identify prior knowledge about a topic (e.g. shared discussion, think-pair-share)

6786657C0F914E02BF356A050C5D2089.description: How the stories of families and the past can be communicated and passed down from generation to generation (e.g. photographs, artefacts, books, oral histories, digital media, museums) and how the stories may differ, depending on who is telling them

0B22BCE2C3444A88A4A781A5D2F046E9.description: How they, their family and friends commemorate past events that are important to them (e.g. birthdays, religious festivals, family reunions, community commemorations)

9B00D39B4D6D4788977B06E70F2B6452.description: The different structures of families and family groups today (e.g. nuclear, only child, large, single parent, extended, blended, adoptive parent, grandparent) and what they have in common

3565977CD4D34E8E892EFFB0821D298B.description: Who the people in their family are, where they were born and raised and showing how they are related to each other, using simple family trees

828FED6626C344F3972631B893323255.description: The reasons some places are special to people and how they can be looked after, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples' places of significance

7B6CAC77DBEF448883ECD4F2F26FE5F0.description: The representation of familiar places, such as schools, parks and lakes on a pictorial map

F70FDA6EA94B4788B99E008D78E1D1C0.description: The globe as a representation of the Earth on which Australia and other familiar countries can be located
